description: Individuals and organizations, such as photographers, event organizers, and businesses, previously used SLS files to display a sequence of images during presentations, exhibitions, or digital signage displays. Now, modern slideshow software typically uses more common formats like .XML , .JSON , or proprietary project files to manage image sequences, not SLS files. Additionally, many popular applications, such as Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Slides, and Adobe Lightroom, have built-in slideshow features that do not require separate playlist files.

common_filenames.description: JpgPlaylist.sls - A generic filename often given to SLS files.
